items.sentence: I can vouch for Tom\'s work. He is really good at what he does.
I can\'t believe Tom and Mary have been together for ten years.
I wouldn\'t have been able to finish the job without your help.
I\'d like to call Tom and see if he can come visit me tomorrow.
From the look on your face, I can tell that you have good news.
He reached out his hand for the knife, but it was too far away.
Tom and Mary often had their morning coffee on the front porch.
Tom became interested in snowboarding when he was about twelve.
I don\'t know for certain whether Tom will sing tonight or not.
I think you and Tom have more in common than you want to admit.
I was surprised how many people came to meet us at the airport.
If you\'d moved faster, you\'d\'ve been able to catch the ball.
Tom said he didn\'t answer Mary\'s letter, because he was busy.
I doubt that Tom planned to spend so much time on that project.

The last time I saw Mary she was dressed in a nurse\'s uniform.
I put some cookies on the table and the kids ate them right up.
If Mary knew how to swim, she would go to the beach more often.
I think we need to be very careful not to hurt Tom\'s feelings.
Tom has a reputation of never letting anyone else say anything.
Tom has finished reading the book that Mary gave him yesterday.

Tom and Mary should tell John that they won\'t be at his party.

Tom told Mary that he grew up in a poor neighborhood in Boston.
Tom was risking losing his job by talking to his boss that way.
Tom was the only one there for me when I really needed someone.
Tom wrote his number on a piece of paper and handed it to Mary.
Are you absolutely sure you want to sell your father\'s guitar?
Are you sure you don\'t want to live at home with your parents?
Something you might want to consider buying is a new briefcase.
Tell Tom that he can get in touch with me at home this evening.
Tom knew how to do that already, so I didn\'t have to show him.
Tom learned later that Mary wasn\'t planning to live in Boston.
Keep your eyes wide open before marriage, half shut afterwards.
It doesn\'t make any difference to me whether Tom comes or not.
We went to Tom\'s house to talk to him, but he wasn\'t at home.
Didn\'t you know that Tom lived in Australia when he was a kid?
Why did you tear the cloth instead of cutting it with scissors?
I thought maybe you\'d changed your mind about going to Boston.
I know a lot of French words, but I can\'t really speak French.

Tom doesn\'t think he\'ll be able to finish the job by himself.
